document.masterDocTitle: The spider family Dysderidae in the Balearic Islands

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 1 – 7. Fig. 1. Dysdera arnedoi Lissner new species. Female, dorsalateral view. Figs 2 – 3. Dysdera crocata C. L. Koch (from St Elm). 2. Male, dorsal view; 3. Female, dorsal view; Figs 4 – 5. Dysdera lata ReUss, 1834; 4. Male, dorsal view; 5. Female, dorsal view. Fig. 6. Harpactea dufouri (Thorell, 1839); Male, dorsal view. Fig. 7. Parachtes riberai Bosmans new species; Male, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Ibiza : Santa Eulalia del Rio ( Denis 1952 ).

Comments. As explained above,
Dysdera balearica
is removed from the synonymy of
Dysdera crocata
and considered a valid species.

Distribution.
Dysdera crocata
has a synanthropic distribution and is the commonest species of the genus across the Balearic Islands .
